subject: Join us for a free branding workshop tomorrow
body:
VIEW IN BROWSER 
View in Your Browser
 
GROW AS A MENTEE 
BECOME A MENTOR 
EMPOWER TEAMS 
 
It's not too late to register!
Join us tomorrow for our free webinar:
Grow Your Brand with Keith Allen West
 
Date
: March 19th
Time
: 11am MT 
Location
: Zoom
Your brand isn’t your colours or your logo; it’s a perception that’s formed by the experiences and interactions someone has with you. 
When you’re intentional about your online (and offline!) presence, you can shape that perception and align it to your goals, while being authentically and uniquely you.
A solid personal brand will help you:
Earn promotions
Nail interviews
Land client projects
Grow an audience online of more than 250,000 people
Seriously increase your income
Build a network of talented mentors you can lean on for support and advice
GROW YOUR BRAND 
 
Keith Allen West is a branding expert, boutique social media influencer, blogger, public speaker and an actor. He is known for his energetic presentations on real world branding and public relations for small business success.
West spends his time between Los Angeles (CA), Savannah (GA), and Albuquerque (NM) when not traveling globally promoting scenic destinations, luxurious hotels, fashion/beauty brands, and the entertainment industry. 
 
He’s been featured in People Magazine, USA Today, VOGUE, Huffington Post, The Guardian, LA Times, NY Times, FOX, CNN, AOL, MSN, NPR and many more media outlets. His small business reality series THE STARTUP on AOL Small Business reached 24 million subscribers. 
 
West has reached the Inc. 500/5000 list with two of his cosmetics companies by growing revenue over 1,000%. Urban Fresh Cosmetics sales ballooned from $200,000 to $5.1 million in just three years. He consults with other quality brands to grow their sales with his trusted methods.
REGISTER 
 
 
 
 
 
HAVE QUESTIONS? VIEW FAQ. 
LISTEN IN: PODCASTS 
THE REAL MENTORS BLOG 
LOGIN TO YOUR ACCOUNT

subject: [Expensify] Travel and expense, at the speed of chat
body:
tl;dr - Introducing Expensify Travel: fully managed corporate travel via web, app, or chat – now available to every Expensify member
 
Travel and expense should go hand in hand… and now they can! We've long been asked by customers big and small for the ability to: 
Book flights, hotels, rail, and car rentals from inside the app.
Limit what inventory employees see to only what is in the authorized travel policy.
Pay for these bookings using a central virtual card.
Capture the travel receipts into an automatic expense report.
Cut travel costs
In 
New Expensify
, press the green + button 
> Book travel
 (or in 
Expensify Classic
, click the 
Travel
 button along the left side of the screen). It does all the things you expect (in-policy booking results, travel-based spend analysis, out-of-policy notices, approvals before booking, duty-of-care reporting), plus a few tricks you don't – courtesy of the realtime chat framework of the New Expensify superapp: 
Realtime duty of care
, which lets you know where all your employees are at all times. We even connect the traveler and travel manager in a dedicated chat room to discuss all bookings and changes the instant they happen, rather than whenever you get around to checking your inbox.
Realtime expense management,
 where every booking receipt and change fee is recorded as an expense that's submitted up through Expensify's realtime approval and next-day reimbursement engine: book today, get paid tomorrow!
Realtime collaboration
, where shared trip chat rooms are automatically created in New Expensify so that everyone is on the same page. From employees to managers, everything you need to know about your trip, all in one place. 
The instant, chat-first design of New Expensify is why we like to say that Expensify does:
Travel and expense at the speed of chat.
To check it out, open your Expensify app and click 
Travel
, or take a peek below!
It's one of the most exciting times to be at Expensify that I can ever remember. We have a 
lot
 going on, and it's energizing to be sharing it with you after so long in development. Keep an eye out for a ton more on the way!
-david
Founder and CEO of Expensify
Questions? Ask me in the 
#new-expensify-feedback
 room! 
PS: Check out OpenAI's work on building an 
artificial engineer
 to solve Expensify App open source projects!
Sent by: Expensify, Inc. - 548 Market St #61434 - San Francisco, CA 94103
To unsubscribe, please click 
here

IDI Assessment Website Migration Starts Today
 
Reminder:  IDI Qualified Administrators (QAs) will receive an email to claim your IDI QA account. Please use the email address associated with your IDI account to log into the new IDI Platform on 
Monday, February 17, 2025
. 
 
The current IDI Assessment Website will be unavailable starting today,
 
Wednesday, February 12, 2025 at approximately 3:00pm EST
, as we migrate to the new IDI Platform.
This means that all functions related to using the IDI (completing the IDI, ordering, generating IDI Reports, etc.) will 
not
 be available from Wednesday, February 12th until the new IDI Platform launches 
Monday, February 17, 2025
.
Please be sure to notify respondents if they are attempting to complete the IDI during this time. Once the migration has finished, you will be able to send account activation emails to your respondents with active Assessments so they can complete the IDI in the new Platform.
 
Some resources to help you prepare for the new IDI Platform are available in your account’s QA Resources page under 
New IDI Platform Resources.
You can find the previous emails sent here:
Announcement & Overview of Features
Original Launch Date & Migration Details
February 17th Launch Date 
All QA resources will move to the IDI Help Center once the new Platform launches. To access all QA-specific resources and articles, you will need to sign into the IDI Help Center (powered by Zendesk), which you can do by clicking the button below. Once signed in, you can track the articles you view and see the status of any support inquiries.
If you have emailed us before, you may already have an account. Signing up will let you know if you need to create an account or simply change your password. 
Sign Up for the IDI Help Center
Your login credentials for the IDI Help Center are 
separate
 from the new IDI Platform. 
Register for Upcoming Platform Events
All upcoming Q&A sessions are listed in Eventbrite.
Click below for details on all upcoming IDI Platform events.
Register
 
Questions?
Please reach out to us: 
support@idiinventory.com
View email in browser
Copyright (C) 2025 IDI, LLC. All rights reserved.
You are receiving this email because you are listed within the IDI, LLC database as an IDI Qualified Administrator or are attending an upcoming IDI Qualifying Seminar. These are only meant for important updates, so please do not unsubscribe. 
Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can 
update your preferences
 or 
unsubscribe

The current IDI Assessment Website will be unavailable starting next
 
Wednesday, February 12, 2025
, as we migrate to the new IDI Platform.
This means that all functions related to using the IDI (completing the IDI, ordering, generating IDI Reports, etc.) will 
not
 be available from Wednesday, February 12th until the new IDI Platform launches 
Monday, February 17, 2025
.
Please be sure to notify respondents if they are attempting to complete the IDI during this time. Once the migration has finished, you will be able to send account activation emails to your respondents with active Assessments so they can complete the IDI in the new Platform.
 
Some resources to help you prepare for the new IDI Platform are available in your account’s QA Resources page under 
New IDI Platform Resources.

Announcement & Overview of Features

subject: Re: AI Data Analytics
body:
Hello Charmen,

I think I'm reaching out to the wrong person. Is there somebody else who I can talk to about how Knowi's business intelligence solution can help you gain total visibility on all your data, enabling you to make better data-driven decisions?

Best,
Erin Cooper
Business Development
Knowi | Oakland, CA
 

Inbox full? Reply ‘nope’ and we’ll take the message (literally).

On Wed, January 22, 2025 5:20 PM, Erin Cooper 

[erin.cooper@demoknowi.com]> wrote:

> Hey Charmen - I came across LCW while looking up companies in the organizational development and consulting industry.
> 
> Seeing as you're the owner of LCW, any chance you'd be interested in using AI to get a more comprehensive view of your data?
> 
> Our AI data analytics solution can help you do just that.
> 
> With Knowi, you can effortlessly get answers to questions like:
> 
> - What is the percentage growth in employee retention attributed to implementing equitable practices across diverse cultures within the last fiscal year? - How many global clients reported improved performance metrics after engaging in tailored training programs focused on inclusion and equity annually?
> 
> It's like ChatGPT, but for your data!
> 
> Would you be interested in learning more?
> 
> Kind regards,
> Erin Cooper
> Business Development
> Knowi | Oakland, CA
>  
> 
> Hard pass? Reply “unsubscribe” and I’ll ghost you faster than an ex with commitment issues.
> On Mon, January 13, 2025 5:33 PM, Erin Cooper 

> [erin.cooper@demoknowi.com]> wrote:
> 
> > Hello Charmen,
> > 
> > Did you get a chance to look over my previous note?
> > 
> > Just like how LCW fosters equity and inclusion in diverse cultures, Knowi fosters data-driven decision-making by unifying varied data sources into instant, AI-powered insights.
> > 
> > Essentially, Knowi specializes in unifying and analyzing data from various sources, providing instant data insights through AI-generated dashboards, and allowing users to ask analytical questions in plain English.
> > 
> > It's like ChatGPT, but for your data!
> > 
> > One of our clients, Ampush, saw 50% savings in total cost of ownership (TCO) after migrating from Tableau to Knowi.
> > 
> > Interested in hearing more?
> > 
> > Warm regards,
> > Erin Cooper
> > Business Development
> > Knowi | Oakland, CA
> >  
> > 
> > If you’re over it, reply “unsubscribe” and I’ll disappear quicker than a coworker at 4:59 PM on a Friday.
> > On Wed, January 8, 2025 6:14 PM, Erin Cooper 

> > [erin.cooper@demoknowi.com]> wrote:
> > 
> > > Hey Charmen,
> > > 
> > > Saw on LinkedIn that you attended Texas Southern University. Did you ever experience the annual Tiger Fest? I heard it's a vibrant celebration with music, food, and activities that truly showcase the spirit and unity of TSU students!
> > > 
> > > That said, curious if you'd be interested in using AI to get total visibility of all your data?
> > > 
> > > Our AI data analytics solution specializes in helping businesses in the organizational development and consulting industry do just that.
> > > 
> > > With Knowi, you can seamlessly get answers to questions like: 
> > > 
> > > - What is the percentage growth in employee retention attributed to implementing equitable practices across diverse cultures within the last fiscal year? - How many global clients reported improved performance metrics after engaging in tailored training programs focused on inclusion and equity annually?
> > > 
> > > It's like ChatGPT, but for your data!
> > > 
> > > Interested in learning more?
> > > 
> > > Best regards,
> > > Erin Cooper
> > > Business Development
> > > Knowi | Oakland, CA

We are excited to announce the new IDI Platform will be launching on 
Monday, February 17, 2025
.
The current IDI Assessment Website will be 
unavailable
 starting 
Wednesday, February 12, 2025
. During the migration period, from February 12th-16th, you will not be able to access your IDI account or data. In addition, respondents will not be able to access the IDI Assessment during that time.
Your IDI data will be migrated to the new Platform and available in your account. If you would like any IDI results in the current report format, you should generate and download those reports no later than 
Tuesday, February 11, 2025
. After the launch, you will be able to generate and download IDI data in the new report format. You can see an example of the new IDI Profile Reports and Intercultural Development Plans (IDP) in your current QA Account under 
QA Resources - New IDI Platform Resources
.

Important information about your Comcast Business account

Notice of our Privacy Policy 
 
 
We believe everyone who uses Comcast Business products and services deserves a safe experience. While you’re working hard to manage your business, please know that we are also working to help protect your employees’ and customers’ personal information, as reflected by our privacy and security commitments. 
 
Each year, we are required to send our customers notice of our 
Privacy Policy
. This can be viewed and downloaded from our 
Privacy Center
. The Privacy Center is a resource to learn about our privacy and security practices, commitments and standards that apply to the services we provide to our Comcast Business customers. We have recently updated the Privacy Center to include additional resources for our business customers, and as our business continues to evolve and expand, we will continue to provide transparency and visibility into our practices. 
 
We value your business and the trust you place in us and appreciate you being a Comcast Business customer. If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to 
contact us

Thank you for being a valued Comcast Business customer.

Jackie Caridad

subject: AI Data Analytics
body:
Hey Charmen - I came across LCW while looking up companies in the organizational development and consulting industry.

Seeing as you're the owner of LCW, any chance you'd be interested in using AI to get a more comprehensive view of your data?

Our AI data analytics solution can help you do just that.

With Knowi, you can effortlessly get answers to questions like:

- What is the percentage growth in employee retention attributed to implementing equitable practices across diverse cultures within the last fiscal year?

subject: Looking Back, Moving Forward: 2024 Summary and 2025 Kick-off
body:
Redesigned Team Chat sidebar, plus a look back at 2024! [
https://click.zoom.com/l/84442/2024-07-22/c5fptt/84442/1721653856lVtLOzdS/zm_cs_banner_bloom.png
] [
https://zoom.com
] Dear Valued Customer, In
 
Redesigned Team Chat sidebar, plus a look back at 2024! 
 
Dear Valued Customer,
 
In 2024, Zoom took major steps to unify the working experience through the launch of Workplace and introduction of productivity tools like Zoom Docs. We also introduced a new generation of AI assistant — AI Companion 2.0 — to help you work and collaborate more efficiently and effectively. 
 
Before we dive into a recap of 2024, let’s take a look at how we’re kicking off the new year!
 
*Note: Some products and features may not be available to all customers.
 
New this year: Redesigned flexible Team Chat sidebar
 
When you update to Zoom app version 6.3.6, you may notice the newly redesigned Team Chat sidebar. With the new customizable sidebar, you can easily organize your workspace by choosing which tabs appear with drag and drop, keeping essentials like direct messages and continuous meeting chats just a click away, decluttering notifications with tab-level badging, accessing a full-suite of tabs under “More,” and quickly finding what you need using advanced sorting and filtering. 
Plus, you can use AI Companion to automate everyday busywork so you can stay on top of what matters and get more done by summarizing unread conversations in key tabs like Folders and Starred, generating action items based on a conversation in any channel, searching for topics and files across chats, and composing messages for you — all in one place. 
Check out our 
blog post
 if you want to learn more about what's possible with Team Chat!
Service Updates
 
Zoom Software Lifecycle Policy -
 
We plan to enforce the next round of our Software Lifecycle Policy on February 1, 2025. Please check our 
support article
 for the table of products and corresponding minimum versions. Users who are running an end-of-life version after February 1 will be logged out of their Zoom app (Desktop, Mobile, and VDI) or not be able to join meetings via the Zoom Client until they update. As always, we highly recommend you regularly download and update to the latest version of Zoom software by checking for updates within the Zoom app or by navigating to 
zoom.us/download
 to take advantage of all our latest security and functionality features.
 
Zoom firewall settings -
 
We are starting to route more traffic across our newer data centers. We want to remind customers to please allow Zoom traffic to all subnets located on our 
Zoom Network Firewall
 page, which includes specific sections by Product, for an optimal experience and to avoid any service disruption. Some of the recently added subnets specific to Zoom Phone & Zoom Contact Center are:
 
144.195.0.0/16
 
206.247.0.0/16
 
170.114.0.0/16
 
159.124.0.0/16
 
147.124.96.0/19
 
Highlights from 2024
 
Now that we’ve looked at how we’re kicking off the new year, here are just a few of the many milestones from 2024: 
 
Fast Company names Zoom one of the world’s most innovative companies of 2024
 
-
 Zoom was named to Fast Company’s prestigious list of the World’s Most Innovative Companies of 2024. The list shines a spotlight on businesses that are shaping industry and culture through their innovations. These organizations are setting new standards and achieving remarkable milestones in all sectors of the economy. Alongside the World’s 50 Most Innovative Companies, Fast Company recognizes 606 organizations across 58 sectors and regions.
 
Zoom Compliance Manager launches
 
-
 In the spring of 2024, we launched Zoom Compliance Manager powered by Theta Lake, a new all-in-one offering that provides archiving, eDiscovery, legal hold, and information protection capabilities to help organizations fulfill regulatory requirements and mitigate organizational communications compliance risks across the Zoom platform.
 
Zoom Workplaces launches, weaving AI throughout the experience
 
-
 
In April 2024, we launched Zoom Workplace, our new, AI-powered collaboration platform designed to help your organization reimagine teamwork by streamlining communications, increasing employee engagement, and improving productivity across flexible work. It’s everything you trust and love about Zoom’s core communications products, combined with our employee engagement, spaces, and productivity solutions, all within the Zoom experience, with AI woven throughout. 
 
AI Onboarding Center helps organizations integrate AI Companion
 
-
 Many tasks can be completed more quickly and efficiently with the help of AI Companion, but that doesn’t mean everyone knows how to take advantage of them. To help administrators and employees take advantage of Zoom AI Companion and start changing the way they work, we created a new 
resource hub
 with downloadable, ready-to-share assets for every product that works with Zoom AI Companion.
 
Zoom introduces beta for Workflow Automation, a no-code workflow builder to boost workplace efficiency
 
-
 
Zoom launched the new Workflow Automation in beta, allowing users to increase efficiency and reduce time spent on routine tasks. Workflow Automation helps users build complex workflows across Zoom Workplace and third-party applications so they can spend time on more meaningful work and collaborate more seamlessly with colleagues. 
 
Single-use Zoom Webinars licenses capacity increased to 1 million attendees
 
-
 We made it easier than ever to host an extra-large, high-capacity virtual gathering with our newest offering: single-use Zoom Webinars licenses that accommodate up to 1 million attendees. Ideal for presenting content to large audiences who don’t need to connect their audio and video to one another, Zoom Webinars is built on our easy-to-use, familiar platform that so many customers have come to know and trust. Our flexible and scalable solutions now enable event organizers to host massive, one-time virtual gatherings with relative ease.
 
AI-first Zoom Docs debuts on Zoom Workplace
 
-
 In August 2024, Zoom launched our AI-first collaborative docs solution. Zoom Docs is powered by Zoom AI Companion, and helps drive productivity and seamless collaboration throughout Zoom Workplace. Zoom Docs can help solve critical challenges facing modern workforces, including time wasted on repetitive tasks, information overload, and facilitation of cross-functional alignment. By utilizing Zoom AI Companion to convert meeting outcomes into actionable documents, Zoom Docs can jumpstart content creation and adapt to different individual and team needs to help boost workers’ productivity. 
 
Workvivo named the only preferred migration partner for Workplace from Meta
 
-
 
As Meta prepared to discontinue their Workplace product, they named Workvivo by Zoom as their only preferred migration partner. Meta and Workvivo worked together to provide 
migration tools
 for migrating and Workvivo provided additional migration services at no further cost to support customers’ transition.
 
Zoom recognized as a Customers’ Choice in the Gartner® Peer Insights™
 
-
 Zoom was recognized as a Customers’ Choice in the 2024 Gartner® Peer Insights™ “Voice of the Customer” report for Unified Communications as a Service (UCaaS). According to Gartner, vendors recognized by customers as a Customers’ Choice meet or exceed the market average for Overall Experience and User Interest and Adoption. 
 
Zoom introduces AI Companion 2.0
 
-
 At Zoomtopia 2024, Zoom announced the next generation of Zoom AI Companion, the AI personal assistant that helps users get more done and is available at no additional cost. Since launching in September 2023, AI Companion has been enabled on more than 4 million accounts, helping users with capabilities like meeting summary, meeting questions, chat compose, and more. The next generation of AI Companion continues to help simplify users’ workdays by sorting through the noise and prioritizing what’s most important with high-quality results. 
 
Zoom named a Leader in the 2024 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™(October) Gartner Magic Quadrant
 
-
 
Gartner named Zoom a Leader in the 2024 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Unified Communications as a Service (UCaaS), Worldwide for the fifth time in a row. The UCaaS report evaluated 11 companies in the unified communications space, and Zoom has been recognized as a Leader in this area. Zoom includes enterprise-grade solutions like Zoom AI Companion, Zoom Contact Center, Zoom Team Chat, Zoom Phone, Zoom Meetings, and Workvivo. 
 
Meet the new Zoom
 
-
 Until November 2024, Zoom’s official name was Zoom Video Communications Inc., reflecting the company’s roots in video communications software. While that is still a priority, Zoom is now about so much more than video meetings. We are an AI-first company delivering modern, hybrid work solutions that enable you to collaborate seamlessly. That’s why we have officially dropped “video” from our legal name and are now known simply as Zoom Communications Inc.
 
 
 
Now that we’ve taken a look at the fantastic year of innovation that was 2024, we want to thank you for being a Zoom customer. We look forward to continuing to work with you as we move forward together into 2025!
 
  
Zoom Success Advisor
 
Catch us on social

subject: Let’s Start the New Year with National Mentoring Month!
body:
VIEW IN BROWSER 
View in Your Browser
 
GROW AS A MENTEE 
BECOME A MENTOR 
EMPOWER TEAMS 
 
HAPPY NEW YEAR! 🎉
As we begin 2025, we’re excited to announce that January is officially 
National Mentoring Month
! This month, we’ll be highlighting the incredible impact that mentorship can have on both mentors and mentees and we invite you to join us in celebrating and growing this powerful community.
NATIONAL MENTORING MONTH
January is all about celebrating the exchange of knowledge and wisdom. 
National Mentoring Month 
is the perfect time to reflect on the value of mentorship and explore how both mentors and mentees benefit from these powerful relationships. Whether you’re starting your mentoring journey or deepening your existing connections, this month offers opportunities for growth and learning for everyone involved.
DATES TO CELEBRATE MENTORING THIS MONTH
January 7th:
 I Am A Mentor Day
January 17th:
 International Mentoring Day
January 21: 
Thank Your Mentor Day
January 31st: Webinar Registration Opens
: Don’t miss the opportunity to sign up for Real Mentors Network’s first webinar in March with featured mentor, Keith West!
MENTOR FEATURE: KEITH WEST
We’re excited to feature Keith West, one of our outstanding mentors, in this month’s newsletter! Keith will be hosting his very first webinar Wednesday, March 19th at 11 am MT, where he’ll share insights on creating personal branding. We are thrilled to have him as part of our network and can’t wait for you to hear from him.
Keith Allen West is a branding expert, boutique social media influencer, blogger, public speaker and an actor. He is known for his energetic presentations on real world branding and public relations for small business success.
 
West spends his time between Los Angeles (CA), Savannah (GA), and Albuquerque (NM) when not traveling globally promoting scenic destinations, luxurious hotels, fashion/beauty brands, and the entertainment industry. 
 
He’s been featured in People Magazine, USA Today, VOGUE, Huffington Post, The Guardian, LA Times, NY Times, FOX, CNN, AOL, MSN, NPR and many more media outlets. His small business reality series THE STARTUP on AOL Small Business reached 24 million subscribers. 
 
West has reached the Inc. 500/5000 list with two of his cosmetics companies by growing revenue over 1,000%. Urban Fresh Cosmetics sales ballooned from $200,000 to $5.1 million in just three years. He consults with other quality brands to grow their sales with his trusted methods.
 
BECOME A MENTOR 
PODCAST FEATURE
If you haven’t already, be sure to check out our podcast series Making Connections, starting with 
Episode 1
: Mentoring Origins and Evolution
.
 
In this episode, we chat with Bob Harvey, the author of Chapter 1 in 
Making Connections: A Handbook for Effective Formal Mentoring Programs in Academia
.  Not in Academia? Not to worry, this podcast discusses the concepts that are applicable in the corporate world as well!
 
 
MENTORING TIP OF THE MONTH
Mentoring Relationships
One of the most effective ways to ensure a successful mentoring relationship is by setting clear expectations from the start - whether you’re a mentor or mentee. This includes defining the goals of the mentorship, how often you’ll meet, and what you hope to accomplish. Clear communication sets the foundation for a strong, productive relationship that benefits everyone.
Mentoring Programs
When establishing a mentoring program, start by 
creating a clear definition of mentoring 
and its key elements: its purpose, who it is for, the skills required, and its ultimate goals. A well-defined framework ensures alignment, sets clear expectations, and maximizes the program’s impact for both mentors and mentees.
READY TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE? REGISTER TO BE A MENTOR!
 
The world needs mentors like you. Are you ready to share your wisdom, offer guidance, and help someone navigate their journey? Sign up today to become a mentor and make a lasting impact on someone’s life and career.
START YOUR JOURNEY 
Thank you for being a part of this community and for considering how you can pay it forward through mentorship. We look forward to seeing the incredible connections we’ll make together this year!
 
 
 
 
 
HAVE QUESTIONS? VIEW FAQ. 
LISTEN IN: PODCASTS 
THE REAL MENTORS BLOG 
LOGIN TO YOUR ACCOUNT

Unsubscribe

subject: What’s New at Zoom | November 2024 Recap
body:
Whether it's new products and features or courses that teach you to use Zoom better, we are constantly evolving to improve your experience. Zoom banner [
https://click.zoom.com/l/84442/2024-07-22/c5fptt/84442/1721653856lVtLOzdS/zm_cs_banner_bloom.png
]
 
Whether it's new products and features or courses that teach you to use Zoom better, we are constantly evolving to improve your experience.
 
Dear Valued Customer,
Whether it's new products and features or courses that teach you to use Zoom better, we are constantly evolving to improve your experience. To help keep you up to date, we have summarized some key new things you should know below. 
Download
 
the latest version of the Zoom desktop client to access all these features and more. 
This is only a selection of the many updates happening on the Zoom platform, so to help you stay up to date, check out: 
 
Preview notes
 –
 A list of upcoming features. This page is only available to Zoom account owners and admins; you must sign in to view them.
 
Release notes
 
–
 A complete list of past releases across the Zoom platform. 
 
If you have questions about the features and announcements outlined below, please reply directly to this email.
 
 
*Note: Some products and features may not be available to all customers.
Events & Training
Zoom Contact Center Insights: Success Stories & New Feature Deep Dives -
 
Register now
 
to learn more about the latest ZCC features and how they can help you streamline your data center operations. 
Legal and Compliance Guide to AI Companion -
 
As a decision-maker for your organization, you need insights into AI Companion’s data protection and privacy features and how they fit with your organization’s data governance requirements. Review our 
Legal and Compliance Guide to AI Companion
 for practical guidance on common approaches for customers to tailor their AI Companion experience to meet their unique legal, compliance, and privacy needs.
Key Highlights from Zoom’s November Releases
Zoom Workplace
 
Updates
 
Meetings Features
 
Unified experience for managing meeting assets
 
(Windows, macOS, Linux) -
 
Users can view and manage meeting assets consistently before, during, and after meetings within the meeting scheduler, calendar card, in-meeting page, and full meeting details page. Meeting assets have a unified UI/UX with consistent grouping, categorization, and functionality across the meeting lifecycle. The calendar meeting card allows users to view the full meeting, transcript, and recording directly within the card, and includes options to share the recording and release it to the cloud meeting client. This provides a seamless experience for accessing and interacting with meeting assets.
Enhancements to AI Companion enablement in meeting scheduler (Windows, macOS, Linux) -
 
A meeting host can enable AI Companion features like meeting summary, in-meeting questions, and smart recording with one click using the AI Companion diamond button. These options are available directly from the Zoom Workplace desktop app's meeting scheduler in the calendar side panel, the Calendar tab's Agenda view, and the Home tab.
 
Surveys & Polls Features
 
Integrate surveys and polls in the Zoom desktop app (Windows, macOS, Linux) -
 
Users can access and manage surveys and polls directly from the Zoom desktop app. They can create new surveys or polls, manage their personal survey library, access survey or poll results, and preview surveys or polls. This integration provides a seamless experience for users to work with surveys and polls within the Zoom desktop app, eliminating the need to switch between different apps.
 
Team Chat Features
 
Continuous Meeting Chat (CMC) apps: In-chat app viewer for seamless content viewing (Windows, macOS, Linux, iOS, Android) -
 Users can view unfurled app content within the chat window without leaving the conversation context. When an app link is shared, users can open and interact with the content directly in the chat, providing a seamless experience.
 
Clip Features
 
Enhancements to admin control for embed feature -
 
Account owners and admins have the option to enable or disable the Clip Embed feature for their entire organization. When enabled, users can embed their recorded clips in external websites or applications, facilitating easy sharing and collaboration. Conversely, disabling the Embed feature restricts clips from being shared outside the organization, ensuring better control over sensitive data and content.
Automatic chapter generation and editing capabilities in Clips (Windows, macOS, Linux, iOS, Android) -
 
Users can automatically generate chapter breakdowns using Zoom AI Companion after recording clips. This feature allows users to easily navigate through their recorded clips by providing a structured overview of the content. Additionally, users have the ability to modify the automatically generated chapters to better suit their preferences.
 
Zoom Phone Features
 
Display icon for available AI call summary in Zoom Assistant for Microsoft users (Windows, macOS, Linux) -
 
Microsoft users can easily identify when an AI-generated summary of their call is ready for review. The Zoom Assistant interface will display an icon to notify users that a summary is available. This enhancement streamlines the process of accessing AI-powered call insights, enabling users to quickly review and leverage the summarized information. This feature must be enabled by Zoom.
 
Zoom Contact Center
 Updates
 
Dynamic agent guide (web portal) -
 
Admins can create conditional steps in the agent guide, allowing the guide to adjust dynamically based on previous steps. When following the guide, agents can choose from a set of options which determines the next step. Agents can return to previous steps to update answers if needed. This makes agent guides adaptable across different scenarios, improving the responsiveness to customer needs.
Sentiment analysis with AI Companion for CTI connector (CTI Connector) -
 
Agents using the CTI connector can view real-time sentiment analysis for any active voice or messaging engagement. Sentiment values (Positive, Neutral, or Negative) appear as soon as the consumer's first message is received and update automatically as more messages or speech come in. Supervisors can monitor sentiment on their dashboards, allowing them to step in if needed. This feature is especially helpful for recognizing if a consumer is frustrated, allowing agents to adjust their conversation style to help de-escalate. This is available in CTI version V3 and must be enabled by Zoom. 
Improved context sharing for transferred engagements (CTI Connector) -
 
When a voice engagement is transferred between agents in Zoom Contact Center, the new agent receives the full context of the interaction. This includes the customer's information, any records or cases created by the previous agent, and notes taken during the engagement. For scenarios with multiple potential customer matches, clarifying information gathered by the first agent is also passed to the next agent. This is available in CTI version V3 and must be enabled by Zoom. 
 
Zoom Revenue Accelerator
 
Updates 
 
Managers can update deal data for their teams (Web portal) -
 
Account owners and admins have the ability to allow managers to update deal data for the sellers on their teams. This permission is configured at the user level within the Zoom for Salesforce Lightning application, where managers must authenticate to gain access. With this feature, managers can make changes to deal data during one-on-one coaching sessions, enabling them to better guide and assist their team members in the sales process.
 
Zoom Virtual Agent
 Updates
 
 
Google Drive integration with Zoom Virtual Agent (Web portal) -
 
Admins can connect to Google Drive and use content from their organization's drive to find answers from .doc, .PDF and HTML files, which are formatted for system use. They can select specific files or folders, choose content from within their organization or any shared links, and set specific drive folders to control what's included. This new knowledge base type broadens the range of available sources, enabling the Virtual Agent to provide more comprehensive responses.
Service Updates
Zoom Software Lifecycle Policy - 
We plan to enforce the next round of our Software Lifecycle Policy on February 1, 2025. Please check our 
support article
 for the table of products and corresponding minimum versions. Users who are running an end-of-life version after February 1 will be logged out of their Zoom app (Desktop, Mobile, and VDI) or not be able to join meetings via the Zoom Client until they update. As always, we highly recommend you regularly download and update to the latest version of Zoom software by checking for updates within the Zoom app or by navigating to 
zoom.us/download
 to take advantage of all our latest security and functionality features.
Catch us on social

subject: What’s New at Zoom | October 2024 Recap
body:
[cid:a0b6af26-797f-4820-a15d-1197b5cd8b6c] [
https://zoom.us/
] DearConner, Whether it's new products and features or courses that teach you to use Zoom better,
 
 
Dear 
Conner
, 
Whether it's new products and features or courses that teach you to use Zoom better, we are constantly evolving to improve your experience. To help keep you up to date, we have summarized some key new things you should know below. 
Download
 the latest version of the Zoom desktop client to access all these features and more. 
 
This is only a selection of the many updates happening on the Zoom platform, so to help you stay up to date, check out:
 
Preview notes
 – A list of upcoming features. This page is only available to Zoom account owners and admins; you must sign in to view them.
 
Release notes
 – A complete list of past releases across the Zoom platform. 
 
 
If you have questions about the features and announcements outlined below, please reply directly to this email.
 
*Note: Some products and features may not be available to all customers.
 
Feature Announcement
Introducing AI Companion 2.0 - 
The newly released AI Companion 2.0 is an AI personal assistant that helps users stay on top of their day and get more done. AI Companion 2.0 is available across Zoom Workplace in a convenient side panel to help users stay up-to-date on important conversations, synthesize information to make faster, more informed decisions, and take action, all with 
reliable, responsible AI
. For more information, check out our recent 
announcement
 and support article on 
how to enable the AI Companion panel in Zoom Workplace
. 
 
 
Business Updates
Zoom: A Leader in the 2024 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for UCaaS report
 - Gartner has named Zoom a leader in the 2024 Magic Quadrant for UCaaS, Worldwide. Read our recent blog and download the report to learn why we’re a leader!
 
 
Key Highlights from Zoom’s October Releases
 
Zoom Workplace App
 
Updates
 
Team Chat Features
Send message to multiple chats or channels at the same time (Win, macOS, iOS, Android) -
 
Users composing a message in Team Chat can now choose to send it to multiple chosen contacts, groups, and channels simultaneously. The message will appear as natively sent in each conversation. Before sending, users can edit the list of recipients. After sending, users can modify the message content from each sent location. This streamlines sharing information across multiple conversations in Team Chat.
 
Image annotation for shared images in Zoom Team Chat (Win, macOS) - 
Users can annotate any image shared in Zoom Team Chat by clicking on the image and selecting the Annotate option. The image opens in an annotation interface, allowing users to mark up the image using various annotation tools. Users can then save the annotated image back into the chat as a new message. This feature streamlines the workflow by enabling direct annotation within the chat, reducing the need for external tools. Note: This feature is available only on macOS and Windows.
 
 
Contact Center Features
 
Outbound WhatsApp messages (Win, macOS, Linux) - 
Agents and users with appropriate permissions can initiate new outbound engagements by sending WhatsApp messages to WhatsApp-compatible phone numbers globally using their integrated WhatsApp Business numbers. When sending a message, users must select an active WhatsApp message template. Customers will be charged based on message template type and recipient country.
 
 
Zoom Workspace Reservation
 Updates
New reservation administrator role management options (web app)
 - 
Account owners and admins can assign a new reservation administrator that can create, edit or delete reservations for the account or location. Admins can control the level of access for Booking Admins by location. This feature must be enabled by Zoom.
 
 
Contact Center
 
Updates
Pass Zoom Contact Center variables to integrated third-party apps (web portal) -
 
Account owners and admins can configure Zoom Contact Center to send global variables to third-party apps. They can create rules to link Zoom variables with data fields in those apps and decide which variables can be accessed. Passing variables into third-party apps allows app developers to use the data to create more personalized and contextually aware experiences for agents while handling engagements. Note: Agents must be using version 6.2.5 of the Zoom client or higher for this feature to work.
 
Multi-language support for surveys across all channels (web portal) -
 
Account owners and admins can create surveys in multiple languages and set a default language. For surveys in multiple languages, the Zoom Contact Center flow must set the Engagement Language. Admins can configure this by setting the language in the Start widget or using the Set Variable widget to assign the Engagement Language. Additionally, admins can set up a flow that employs a dynamic method, like the Collect Input widget for customer language selection. Surveys will trigger based on this language across voice, video, and messaging channels. If no language is set, the default version will be used. Admins can preview, edit, and delete each language version from queue settings or the flow builder. Survey language editing is now managed in Survey Management.
 
 
Zoom Revenue Accelerator
 
Updates
View Coaching Activity Tracker for sales leaders (web portal) - 
Zoom Revenue Accelerator's Coaching Activity Tracker allows sales leaders to quickly understand what managers are coaching their teams and the last time that they coached them. Sales leaders can access a unified coaching metrics dashboard that provides a hierarchical, organizational view as well as a team-specific view of coaching activities. The dashboard offers clear visibility into the number of calls invited, joined, listened to, scored, and commented on during a given period. Intuitive filter selections and consistency between the team-specific and roll-up hierarchical views are included.
 
 
Service Updates
 
Zoom Software Lifecycle Policy - 
We plan to enforce the next round of our Software Lifecycle Policy on February 1, 2025. Please check our 
support article
 for the table of products and corresponding minimum versions. Users who are running an end-of-life version after February 1 will be logged out of their Zoom app (Desktop, Mobile, and VDI) or not be able to join meetings via the Zoom Client until they update. As always, we highly recommend you regularly download and update to the latest version of Zoom software by checking for updates within the Zoom app or by navigating to 
zoom.us/download
 to take advantage of all our latest security and functionality features.
Happy Zooming,
Zoom Success Advisor
 
You're receiving this email because you are a Zoom customer.
 
If you wish to be removed from our email list, 
unsubscribe
 
or 
manage your email preferences.

subject: IDI Platform Launch Delayed
body:
The new IDI Platform's launch has been delayed.
 
IDI Platform Launch Delayed
Due to an unforeseen delay in the development process, we have decided to postpone the launch of the IDI Platform. We are dedicated to delivering a complete platform that enhances the experience for you and your respondents. We anticipate the Platform will launch before the end of 2024 and will provide a new timeline as soon as we have more information.
In the meantime, the current IDI Assessment Website will continue to function as it has been, allowing you to proceed with your IDI projects without interruption. We understand that this delay may impact your planning, and we sincerely appreciate your understanding and patience during this time.
Resources to help you prepare for the new IDI Platform are available in your QA Resources account under

subject: Upcoming Webinar Cancelled

The upcoming IDI Platform Preview Webinar (October 29, 2024) has been cancelled.
 
IDI Platform Preview Webinar Cancelled
Due to ongoing development, we are cancelling next week’s IDI Platform Preview Webinar. We will instead release short videos dedicated to showing key processes in the new IDI Platform. These short videos will cover the most common processes a QA completes in their IDI account, including ordering, viewing IDI Reports, and creating Report Groups of multiple respondents.

subject: ICYMI: IDI Platform Launches Nov 11 🚀
body:
Get ready for the new IDI Platform.
 
New IDI Platform Launches Nov. 11
The new IDI Platform will be launching on Monday, November 11th! The current IDI Assessment Website will be unavailable starting November 7th as we migrate to the Platform.
In our last email, we presented some of the new features the new IDI Platform will offer.
Listed below is more information to help you prepare. Also, details about upcoming Webinars dedicated to the new IDI Platform are at the bottom of the email, including a link to register.
Unused Assessment Expiration
In the new IDI Platform, unused Assessments will expire after two (2) years. They can still be re-assigned to a new respondent after purchase within that two-year timeframe.
Unused “Legacy” Assessments (IDI Login Codes from the current system that have not been submitted) will start their two-year expiration window at Launch. These will expire in November of 2026.
What will migrate to the Platform?
All submitted IDI data in active accounts
Any active (unsubmitted) IDI Login Codes and Prepaid Credits ordered since May 28, 2019 (the launch of the current IDI Assessment Website, “v5”)
The respondent of any unsubmitted IDI Login Code created after 
October 11, 2024
 which has an assigned email address will automatically receive an email to create their respondent account and complete the IDI when the Platform launches.
Click the button below for more details about what will and will not be migrated to the new IDI Platform.
Learn More
What will not migrate?
Any active IDI Login Code ordered before May 28, 2019 will 
not
 be migrated to the new IDI Platform. These are not compatible with the Platform’s infrastructure.
Submitted IDI data in archived accounts will also not migrate, regardless of order date. If you are receiving this and have an IDI account, then your account is active.
The current version of IDI Reports (Profile Reports and IDPs) will no longer be available in the Platform. If you need to access the current version of those Reports, you will need to do so before 
November 7, 2024
.
Customized question data will also not be migrating and has to be exported from the current IDI Assessment Website if that information is needed. Once migration begins, that information will be fully deleted from the IDI databases and cannot be recovered.
Exporting Customized Question Data
Respondents will not be grouped together in the new IDI Platform after the migration. Instead, to create an IDI Group Profile Report or organize your respondents into specific groups, you will need to create a new Report Group and add each respondent (individually or in bulk) to that Report Group (or multiple Report Groups, as needed). Once completed, you will be able to generate an IDI Group Profile Report for that particular group in the Platform.
The IDI Individual Profile Review (formerly the “ODP”)
Any unused Student Online IDI Debriefs in the current IDI Assessment Website will be migrated to the Platform and available as the new, updated IDI Individual Profile Review for Students. In the new IDI Platform, IDI Individual Profile Reviews can only be purchased as part of an order for IDI Student Assessments. However, should you have any Online IDI Debriefs that were ordered as a separate purchase in the current IDI Assessment Website, these will be available as IDI Individual Profile Reviews in the new Platform. You will be able to assign those to Student IDI Assessments for up to two (2) years after launch. Any completed Online IDI Debriefs connected to the existing IDI Assessment Website will no longer be available.
Learn More
What next?
Later this month, we will be offering two Webinars to give you a first look at the new Platform and guide you through the new IDI Reports. These Webinars will be recorded and made available to all QAs if you are not able to attend live.
Updated IDI Reports
October 22 | 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM ET
This Webinar will guide you through changes to the IDI Individual Profile Report, Intercultural Development Plan (IDP), and IDI Group Profile Report.
IDI Platform Preview
October 28 | 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM ET
We will present the new IDI Platform and demonstrate some of the processes and changes from the current IDI Assessment Website.
We will also be offering follow-up Q&A sessions to answer your questions around how the changes will affect your IDI work. These will be added in the coming days.
Click below for details on all upcoming IDI Platform events.
Register
Questions?
Please reach out to us: 
support@idiinventory.com
Let’s get social
Follow us on social media to keep in touch.
View email in browser

subject: What’s New at Zoom | September 2024 Recap
body:
Dear 
Conner
, 
 
Whether it's new products and features or courses that teach you to use Zoom better, we are constantly evolving to improve your experience. To help keep you up to date, we have summarized some key new things you should know below. 
Download
 the latest version of the Zoom desktop client to access all these features and more. 
 
This is only a selection of the many updates happening on the Zoom platform, so to help you stay up to date, check out:
 
Preview notes
 – A list of upcoming features. This page is only available to Zoom account owners and admins; you must sign in to view them.
Release notes
 – A complete list of past releases across the Zoom platform. 
 
If you have questions about the features and announcements outlined below, please reply directly to this email.
 
*Note: Some products and features may not be available to all customers.
 
Events & Training
Registration is open for Zoomtopia 2024!
 Zoomtopia, our flagship conference, is back for 2024! During this year’s virtual event on Oct. 9, we’re spotlighting groundbreaking innovations that are transforming the way we connect and collaborate. 
Review the agenda and register today! 
On-demand Webinar: Zoom’s Approach to AI Privacy and Security
 - Sign up to watch our recent webinar on how Zoom tackles trust, data privacy, and security in AI implementation. We dig into the controls Zoom provides to help accounts roll out Zoom AI Companion features safely and securely within their organization. Then, we hear from Zoom’s Chief Information Security Officer, Michael Adams, and Chief Privacy Officer, Lisa Owings, as they discuss Zoom’s data security, privacy, and compliance strategy, emphasizing the importance of trust in Zoom’s platform. 
Key Highlights from Zoom’s September Releases 
Zoom Workplace App
 
Updates 
Manage signed-in devices and sessions -
 Windows, macOS, Linux, iOS, iOS (Intune), Android, Android (Intune) - From both the Zoom Workplace app and the Web Portal, users can manage devices and sessions where they are logged in, with the ability to log out of individual devices or log out of all devices and sessions. This feature may not be immediately available, as it is dependent on a backend server update. 
Meeting Features 
Ability for participants to enable AI companion and meeting summary without host - 
Windows, macOS, Linux, iOS, iOS (Intune), Android, Android (Intune) - The Allow participants to start AI Companion when the host is not in the meeting setting has been added to the web portal. This setting allows account owners and admins to let participants activate Zoom AI Companion features, such as Ask AI Companion and Meeting Summary, within the Workplace app before the host joins. However, if the Ask AI Companion and Meeting Summary features are not enabled, participants will receive a prompt stating that the host must be present to start using them. 
Team Chat Features 
Granular controls for message editing and deletion in Team Chat -
 Windows, macOS, Linux, iOS, Android - Users can be restricted from editing or deleting messages in Team Chat based on account and group settings configured by admins. These settings allow admins to maintain message integrity and compliance. If a user belongs to multiple groups with conflicting settings, the most restrictive setting takes precedence, unless a priority group is set. This feature provides data integrity and audit trails for organizations with strict messaging requirements. 
Contact Center Features 
Smart Compose with AI Companion - 
Windows, macOS - Agents can use the Smart Compose with AI Companion to generate responses to customer messages. By giving prompts or guidelines, the Smart Compose feature creates a personalized, first-person response as if the agent is speaking directly to the customer. This feature helps agents work more efficiently and offers a more personalized experience for customers. 
Manual message translation - 
Windows, macOS - Account owners and admins can enable the manual translation feature for inbound messages. When enabled, agents can manually translate individual inbound messages into their preferred language, regardless of the messaging channel. This feature offers ad-hoc translation assistance for agents and supervisors communicating with international consumers. 
Disable agent camera in video engagements - 
Windows, macOS - Admins can disable the video camera for some agents in Zoom Contact Center video engagements, including video escalations. This can be applied at the account or queue level, preventing agents from using their video camera. Admins can set a default profile picture or avatar to represent agents when their camera is disabled. This feature helps contact centers control agent video presence, ensuring privacy and maintaining brand standards. This feature must be enabled by Zoom. 
Zoom Phone
 
Updates 
Bulk site management for holidays and force majeure situations -
 Account owners and admins can make bulk updates to multiple sites' holiday hours, greetings, call routing, and other settings. For planned events like holidays, they can schedule updates in advance. In case of emergencies or last-minute events, admins can quickly select impacted sites and apply temporary changes. Updates can be made via the bulk-update interface or by importing a CSV file. Admins can also set up notifications for upcoming expiration dates and assign roles for this functionality. This empowers admins to swiftly adapt operations across their locations during changing circumstances. This feature must be enabled by Zoom. 
Zoom Web
 
Updates 
Remove Merge Meetings and Calendar tabs toggle - 
The web setting to merge the Meetings and Calendar tabs has been removed from the Zoom web portal. For Zoom Workplace app version 6.2.0 and higher, the tabs are now permanently merged to enhance visibility of calendar views and meeting details. This update allows for easier access to upcoming meetings, invitee information, shared materials, and past meeting assets like recordings and chats. If your Zoom Workplace app version is lower than 6.2.0 and you have the Merge Meetings and Calendar tabs toggle disabled prior to September 16, 2024, you will still see separate tabs for Meetings and Calendar. Once you upgrade to version 6.2.0, the Calendar and Meetings tab will merge, and you won't have the option to return to separate tabs. 
Zoom Events
 
Updates 
Account admins gain comprehensive visibility into the Zoom Events hub -
 Account owners and admins can access the Events and Recordings tabs within the Zoom Events hub with view permission. This enhancement provides account admins with a complete overview of the hub, enabling them to monitor usage and oversee activities more effectively. Previously, account admins had limited visibility, as they could only view certain tabs such as Summary and VOD, but not crucial sections like Event and Recording. 
Add Pledge donation component for fundraiser events -
 Event organizers can add a pledge donation component to the Page Builder for fundraiser events. This component will appear in the components panel when an event is designated as a fundraiser type. Organizers can drag and drop the pledge component onto the editing canvas, where it will render the donate component. This component can be treated like the register component, allowing organizers to drag and drop, duplicate, delete, or save it into reusable blocks. They can customize settings like the primary button text, color, hover state, and padding for the pledge component. This feature allows organizers to create engaging fundraiser event pages with integrated pledge donation functionality. 
Promotion codes for Zoom Events hosts and attendees - 
Hosts can create and manage promotion codes (discount and access codes) mapped to specific events to provide discounts on ticket purchases via discount codes and/or unlock ticket offers via access codes. Discount codes can be set up with validation rules and refund policies. Attendees can apply one code during event registration to receive the discounted price. This helps reduce event costs for hosts while making events more affordable for attendees through promotional pricing. Access codes can be set up with the validation rules and associated with the tickets of each event. Attendees can apply one access code during event registration to unlock the accessibility to the corresponding tickets. 
Zoom Virtual Agent
 
Updates 
Testing experience for campaigns and bot flows - 
Admins can test their bot campaigns and flows in a sandbox environment without needing to set up websites or allowlist URLs. They can customize the sandbox to match the live site and check all campaign settings for branding. Admins can preview and test the entire consumer experience, including widgets, quick replies, knowledge base articles, and chat modals. This ensures everything looks and works right before going live. 
Bot flow debugging - 
Admins and bot flow designers can see debugging information on engagement id, widgets, knowledge base, intent matching, and HTTP calls. They can see detailed internal information like widget names and IDs, condition parameters, intent match phrases and scores, and HTTP call statuses. This helps admins find and fix issues more efficiently during testing. 
Alerts and notifications about anomalies and critical events within Intent Management - 
Admins can receive notifications when unusual patterns in intent trends are detected, such as sudden increases or decreases in intent detection time. Alerts are triggered when the detection time exceeds a set threshold compared to the previous period. Additionally, admins can define different notifications based on the number of intents for different categories, including Untrained, Unpublished, and Suggested intents. They can customize the notification settings, including the type and frequency of alerts, and review the alert history for auditing purposes. This feature keeps admins informed about changes in user behavior that could impact their business. 
Service Updates 
  
Zoom Software Lifecycle Policy -
 We plan to enforce the next round of our Software Lifecycle Policy on November 2, 2024. Please check our 
support article
 for the table of products and corresponding minimum versions. Users who are running an end-of-life version after November 2 will be logged out of their Zoom app (Desktop, Mobile, and VDI) or not be able to join meetings via the Zoom Client until they update. As always, we highly recommend you regularly download and update to the latest version of Zoom software by checking for updates within the Zoom app or by navigating to 
zoom.us/download
 to take advantage of all our latest security and functionality features.
Happy Zooming,
Zoom Success Advisor

subject: What’s New at Zoom | August 2024 Recap
body:
Dear Conner, Whether it's new products and features or courses that teach you to use Zoom better, we are constantly evolving to improve your experience. To help keep
 
 
Dear 
Conner
, 
 
Whether it's new products and features or courses that teach you to use Zoom better, we are constantly evolving to improve your experience. To help keep you up to date, we have summarized some key new things you should know below. 
Download
 the latest version of the Zoom desktop client to access all these features and more. 
 
This is only a selection of the many updates happening on the Zoom platform, so to help you stay up to date, check out:
 
Preview notes
 – A list of upcoming features. This page is only available to Zoom account owners and admins; you must sign in to view them.
Release notes
 – A complete list of past releases across the Zoom platform. 
 
If you have questions about the features and announcements outlined below, please reply directly to this email.
 
*Note: Some products and features may not be available to all customers.
 
New Features
Introducing Zoom Docs -
 Zoom Docs allows users to collaborate and track projects easily and seamlessly. Users can draft, organize, and share materials and documents whether they are in a meeting or not. To make the most of their meetings, users can transform past and present meetings into actionable documents, wikis, and projects using Meeting AI templates. Zoom’s AI Companion features further enhance efficiency by generating and translating content. While creating materials, users have access to basic editing tools, block actions, and various content types that can be added or embedded. In addition, documents can be shared directly with other users or through Team Chat channels. For more information, check out our 
guide to getting started with Zoom Docs.
 
Events & Training
What’s New at Zoom Webinar
 - 
Register to join us for this monthly session on Oct. 3 at 8/11 am (PST/EST). You will have the chance to learn about new Zoom products and features and how they can help you improve collaboration, increase productivity, and maximize the value of Zoom.  
Key Highlights from Zoom’s August Releases
 
Zoom Workplace App
 Updates
 
Meeting features
Enhanced sharing ability of pre-attached assets in meetings - Windows, macOS, Linux - 
Users can effortlessly share pre-attached assets during meetings. This feature allows meeting participants to attach files in advance or reuse them for future meetings, enabling hosts and invitees to seamlessly integrate meeting assets into sessions. They can collaborate on a Whiteboard and open assets in separate tabs or native application windows, supporting various file types and cloud services for a streamlined sharing experience with minimal clicks.
 
Webinar features
Enable or disable Watch Livestream link for overflow attendees - Windows, macOS, Linux -
 Hosts can enable or disable the Watch Livestream link on the overflow dialog for attendees during a meeting or a webinar session. When a meeting or webinar reaches capacity, attendees have the option to watch the livestream if the host has enabled this setting. The default setting will be changed to enabled, allowing overflow attendees to automatically access the livestream. Hosts can disable this option if they prefer not to redirect attendees to the livestream. This feature provides hosts greater control over the overflow experience for attendees, ensuring they can participate in the meeting or webinar presentation.
 
Team Chat features
Pin Zoom Docs to Team Chat channel tabs - Windows, macOS, Linux, iOS, Android - 
Team Chat users can now pin existing or create new Zoom Docs directly within a channel tab. Once pinned, the doc is accessible to all channel members and can be viewed in split view mode alongside the chat. Pinning a doc follows the same user permissions as adding channel tabs. This feature enhances productivity by enabling teams to seamlessly reference and work on documents together within their chat conversations.
 
Mail and Calendar features
Auto-reply drafting for email conversations - Windows, macOS - 
Using the Email Compose with AI Companion, users can have email replies automatically drafted for them. When replying to an email, the AI Companion analyzes the full context of the previous messages in the conversation and generates a draft reply. This allows users to quickly review and send responses without manually providing context. The auto-reply drafting enhances productivity by saving time spent composing replies.
 
Zoom Clips features
Search functionality for Zoom Clips transcripts - Windows, macOS, Linux, iOS, Android - 
Users have the ability to search through the transcripts of their Zoom Clips recordings. By entering keywords or phrases, users can locate and navigate directly to relevant moments within a clip's transcript. This search functionality enables users to efficiently find and replay specific sections of interest within their recorded Zoom Clips content, enhancing the overall user experience.
 
Zoom Web
 Updates
Enhanced AI Companion Results with OCR and Chat Messages - 
Zoom will be enhancing AI Companion results by incorporating screen shared content via optical character recognition (OCR) and in-meeting chat messages. This additional context allows AI Companion to create more accurate, reliable, and complete results. Administrators can manage these settings in Account Settings under the AI Companion tab in the web portal.
Allow meeting hosts to retain and access meeting transcripts - 
Administrators can choose to have meeting transcripts generated by Meeting Summary with AI Companion saved. Once saved, they are accessible by meeting hosts and can be downloaded as a VTT file from the list of available transcripts. These saved transcripts cannot be shared directly through Zoom. Hosts can also generate Zoom Docs from these meeting transcripts with Docs content generation and revision with AI Companion.
 
Zoom Phone
 Updates
Opt-in/opt-out APIs and webhooks for SMS - 
Users can receive webhook events when an SMS recipient sends an opt-out to a Zoom Phone number. The event includes the recipient's phone number, timestamp, and the Zoom Phone number that received the opt-out. Users can also apply opt-in and opt-out rules for specific recipient contacts on Zoom Phone numbers via an API. This allows users to enforce opt-in and opt-out compliance rules across their organization programmatically.
Call recording transcription available in multiple languages - 
Additional languages are integrated across various Zoom Phone features. Users can select from a wider range of languages for call recording transcription, including Chinese (Simplified), Chinese (Traditional), German, French (France and Canada), Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, Russian, and Spanish (EU and US). This feature must be enabled by Zoom.
 
Zoom Events & Sessions
 Updates
Support single-use webinars of up to 1 million participants - 
Users can purchase a single-use webinar license for a webinar with up to 1 million participants. This option provides the flexibility to choose a plan that suits their event needs without any long-term commitments. The single-use license is applicable for a minimum of 10,000 attendees and will expire 3 months from the date of purchase.
Automatic browser-based event and session survey triggering - 
Hosts can configure the ability to automatically have the event survey open in the attendee's browser when the event ends or when the attendee leaves the event. This functionality applies to single-session events (meetings and webinars) and recurring events. Multi-session events are not covered at this time.
Watch Zoom Events recording playback with AI-powered smart chapters - 
Hosts can provide an enhanced recording playback experience for attendees in the event lobby by integrating AI-powered smart chapters. Attendees can navigate through longer recordings using automatically generated smart chapters that provide an overview of the content. The recording player incorporates smart chapters if the feature is enabled on the account.
 
Zoom Revenue Accelerator
 Updates
Automated scorecards evaluate sales interactions - 
Automated scorecards provide a baseline score and leverage AI to evaluate sales conversations and interactions. Sales leaders can filter through certain sales methodologies, select from pre-set questions, and view scorecard analytics for only automated scorecards or manual scorecards. Account owners and admins can build scorecards with custom criteria and have an AI model automatically score conversations based on those metrics. The automated evaluations provide sales leaders and admins with feedback on areas of strength and improvement. This feature evaluates more conversations and gains insights into overall sales performance trends. 
Note: Automatic scorecards without an overall score will be omitted from the analytics charting.
View Coaching Activity Tracker for sales leaders -
 Zoom Revenue Accelerator's Coaching Activity Tracker allows sales leaders to quickly understand what managers are coaching their teams and the last time that they coached them. Sales leaders can access a unified coaching metrics dashboard that provides a hierarchical, organizational view as well as a team-specific view of coaching activities. The dashboard offers clear visibility into the number of calls invited, joined, listened to, scored, and commented on during a given period. Intuitive filter selections and consistency between the team-specific and roll-up hierarchical views are included.
Support for additional languages - 
Zoom Revenue Accelerator (ZRA) supports additional languages, enhancing the overall user experience. The new supported languages include Romanian, Turkish, Thai, Czech, Estonian, Hungarian, and Malay. Users can easily switch between languages within the ZRA interface, allowing seamless communication and collaboration across diverse teams and regions. This expanded language support empowers users to utilize ZRA's features while working in their preferred language.
 
Zoom Contact Center
 Updates
Save SMS conversation transcripts in CRM systems - 
Admins can enable or disable the automatic saving of SMS transcripts within the CRM systems, such as Zendesk, Salesforce, ServiceNow, and MS Dynamics 365. When enabled, agents using CTI connector can review the full context of their SMS interactions with customers within the CRM. The transcript is formatted with participant names, timestamps, and captioned text, and includes any attachments like files or images. Personally identifiable information (PII) can be redacted from the transcripts based on admin preferences.
Outbound (1-1) email engagements for agents - 
Agents and supervisors can initiate outbound (1-1) email engagements with consumers. They can search and select a contact from the address book or manually enter an email address. Agents can select a configured From email account and associate the outbound email with a queue. Supervisors can view the engagement direction as Outbound in the engagements tab. Agents cannot send emails to unsubscribed consumers.
Consumer engagement history across channels - 
Agents and supervisors can view the engagement history for consumers for multiple channels, including email, authenticated messaging, and social media. The engagement history is linked based on the consumer's unique identifier, such as email address, authenticated consumer ID, or social media ID. Agents and supervisors can access key details like engagement duration, events, assigned agent, notes, and conversation summary. This allows agents to better understand the consumer's journey and provide personalized service.
 
Zoom Virtual Agent
 Updates
Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) answer generation - 
Admins can leverage RAG Answer Generation for more accurate and contextual responses to customer inquiries. This feature integrates the customer-approved knowledge base content with a Large Language Model (LLM) to create conversational answers. The LLM generates intelligent responses by referencing content from knowledge base sources, striking a balance between AI-driven intelligence and admin-controlled source material. This approach ensures that answers are both contextually relevant and grounded in approved information. Admins have the flexibility to enable this feature at the bot level by opting in to Answer Generation, giving them control over when and how this advanced capability is utilized.
 
Zoom Whiteboard
 Updates
Ability to restrict external link sharing for Zoom Whiteboard - 
Admins can disable external link sharing within their organization. If the Allow external link sharing checkbox is unchecked in the admin portal under the Sharing section, the option Anyone can access is disabled in the share sheet. A tooltip displays "Your admin has disabled this function" when users attempt to share a link externally. This feature gives admins more control over external collaboration while still allowing external users to be invited.
Restrict viewer actions on shared whiteboards - 
Owners and co-owners can restrict viewers from exporting, duplicating, downloading content, or making templates from their whiteboards. By default, all actions are enabled for viewers. Owners can choose whether the restrictions apply to all viewers or only external viewers. This feature gives document owners greater control over how their whiteboards are accessed and used by viewers.
 
Zoom Scheduler
 Updates
Support Webhooks for API - 
With Webhooks for API, Zoom Scheduler users can integrate different systems and automate workflows, enabling admins to authorize third parties to trigger actions during the booking process.
 
Service Updates
 
Zoom Software Lifecycle Policy - 
We plan to enforce the next round of our Software Lifecycle Policy on November 2, 2024. Please check our 
support article
 for the table of products and corresponding minimum versions. Users who are running an end-of-life version after November 2 will be logged out of their Zoom app (Desktop, Mobile, and VDI) or not be able to join meetings via the Zoom Client until they update. As always, we highly recommend you regularly download and update to the latest version of Zoom software by checking for updates within the Zoom app or by navigating to 
zoom.us/download
 to take advantage of all our latest security and functionality features.
Happy Zooming,
Zoom Success Advisor

subject: Introducing the New IDI Platform: Coming Soon
body:
The new IDI Platform is coming this November!
 
Coming Soon:
New IDI Platform
We are thrilled to announce that we will be launching the brand new IDI Platform this November. This new Platform provides streamlined experiences and exciting new features.
The new Platform will replace the current IDI Assessment Website (sometimes referred to as “v5”) and will be the hub for individuals to access the Intercultural Development Inventory and IDI accounts.
We will be providing more details on the Platform’s capabilities via email in the coming weeks leading up to the Launch date. However, we want to share an overview of the new features and changes with you here:
IDI Assessment Updates
Demographic questions in the IDI have been expanded. As always, the responses to these questions will not impact IDI results.
Learn More
The Intercultural Development Inventory will be available in American Sign Language (ASL). We have partnered with Gallaudet University to create videos that can be accessed in the IDI assessment.
Learn More
Simplified Chinese is being added for respondents completing the IDI.
Learn More
To ensure a seamless respondent experience, custom questions will not be available in the new Platform.
Learn More
Updated IDI Reports
IDI Reports have been restructured and updated to maximize effectiveness with respondents and for QAs. At Launch, any existing respondent data can be used to generate these updated IDI Reports.
Learn More
All IDI Reports (including the Intercultural Development Plan) will be available in eight (8) total languages, with more languages to be added in the future.
Learn More
New Respondent Experience
Respondents will have their own accounts to easily track any IDI-related activity in one place.
Learn More
The IDI Profile Report Review for Students (formerly the ODP) is updated and will be completed within the  respondent account.
Learn More
Updated Pricing
At Launch, new pricing will be in effect for both the IDI Qualifying Seminar and IDI assessments.
Learn More
What next?
We will provide more details on other new features in the coming weeks. Starting in October and through the Platform’s launch, we will be offering Webinars to go over the changes to Reports and the Platform itself. There will also be live Q&A sessions available as a follow-up to the Webinars (which will be recorded).
Additionally, there will be a few days ahead of the Launch of the IDI Platform in November when the existing IDI Assessment Website will be unavailable while data is migrated and the new Platform is brought online.
Your IDI Data
You will 
not
 lose access to the respondents’ IDI results from your existing account. All submitted IDI results will be migrated into the new IDI Platform and will be accessible at Launch in the new Platform’s format.
Let’s get social
Follow us on social media to keep in touch.
